title: A Particular Lenticular Cloud
summary: Landsat 8’s Operational Land Imager acquired this image of an elongated lenticular cloud, locally nicknamed the “Taieri Pet,” above New Zealand’s South Island on Sept. 7, 2024. Lenticular clouds form when prevailing winds encounter a topographic barrier, such as a mountain range. Wind that is forced to flow up and over the mountains creates a […]

title: Station Science Top News: Oct. 25, 2024
summary: Better Monitoring of the Air Astronauts Breathe Ten weeks of operations showed that a second version of the Spacecraft Atmosphere Monitor is sensitive enough to determine variations in the composition of cabin air inside the International Space Station. Volatile organic compounds and particulates in cabin air could pose a health risk for crew members, and this device […]

title: Carissa Arillo: Testing Spacecraft, Penning the Owner’s Manuals
summary: Flight operations engineer Carissa Arillo helped ensure one of the instruments on NASA’s PACE mission made it successfully through its prelaunch testing. She and her group also documented the work rigorously, to ensure the flight team had a comprehensive manual to keep this Earth-observing satellite in good health for the duration of its mission. Name: […]

title: Avio to Build First US-Based Solid Rocket Motor Production Facility
summary: Italian rocket builder Avio has selected commercial real estate development company ACMI Properties to design its first US-based solid rocket motor production facility. Arlington-headquartered Avio USA was incorporated on 25 April 2022. At the time, Avio stated that the wholly-owned subsidiary would be used to “explore business opportunities in the US market.” By 2023, the […]

title: Live coverage: China to launch 3 taikonauts to the Tiangong space station
summary: The launch features two crew members who are making their first trip to space. Liftoff is set for 4:27 a.m. BJT on Oct. 30 (4:27 p.m. EDT, 2072 UTC on Oct. 29).

title: NASA Sets Coverage for its SpaceX Crew-9 Dragon Station Relocation
summary: In preparation for the arrival of NASA’s SpaceX 31st commercial resupply services mission, four crew members aboard the International Space Station will relocate the agency’s SpaceX Crew-9 Dragon spacecraft to a different docking port Sunday, Nov. 3. Live coverage begins at 6:15 a.m. EDT on NASA+ and will end shortly after docking. Learn how to watch […]

title: Avio picks developer for first US rocket motor production facility
summary: Italian rocket maker Avio plans to set up its first solid motor production facility in the United States in 2028 to capture growing demand in the space and defense markets.

title: SpaceX almost ditched the insane Starship booster catch at the last second

title: Astron Systems  focuses on reusuable two-stage rocket
summary: SAN FRANCISCO – U.K. startup Astron Systems intends to develop a fully reusable two-stage rocket to transport about 360 kilograms to low-Earth orbit. “The main driver of cost and time […]
